page.title: 09Housing in Stirling
page.content: In the old part of the town the houses are about 300 years old. Some of them have been modernised and turned into flats. In Kelly Court new shelter houses have been built for old people with a warden and special accommodation for friends and relatives to visit. The houses in the centre of the town are about 200 years old. Nearly all the ground floor flats have been made into shops. Council housing estates were built in the Raploch area during the last 60 years. Houses near the Gowan Hill were built with flat roofs but whenever it rained dampness was caused so the roofs were replaced with sloping roofs. Other Council houses and flats have been built on the other side of the river, where there is also an estate of private houses.
